title_sort: reuben farwell to walt whitman, 8 june 1864
title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 8 June 1864
text: Dear FriendI once promised to write you & as often as convient[convenient]So far I have fullfilled[fulfilled] my part. Since my joineing[joining] My Regiment It has been nothing but marching & fighting the Johnnys. I can say that we are enough for them if not too muchThere has not been a fight but what they have been worstedOur Cavalry forces have started on an other raid of 10 days rationsI left the Regiment last Monday. The reason of my leaveing[leaving] was because I could not see to ride or walk. I was poisioned[poisoned] how or in what manner I can not tell.I will write to you as often as possible Even if it is pencil marksI hope that this may find you enjoying good health Give my respects to the inmates of Ward. A, of Armory Square Hospital & tell Thom. Woodwurth that I would be very glad to hear from him. I will close by hopeing[hoping] to see you before longShould you wish to write Direct to Com. H. First Mich. Cav. first Brig. first Division. Washington DCRuben FarwellTo Walt Whitman Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 8 June 1864
